creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: very skinny old woman with sunken mouth, a beaklike nose, beady eyes, and bun piled high on head sits side-saddle on a rug draped over an ox; woman holds a flutelike instrument in PL hand, faces viewer; inscription URQ
inscription: URQ: [The blood of the lovely concubine dripped on Ma Wei slope; / Chao-chun, full of resentment, was sent across the border. / How can they compare with this old hag, / Firmly seated on the back of an ox, singing a song of peace]
markings: marks: top edge when rolled, blue pen: [Beisanjin Hag]; upper center, square intaglio: 田國之印; upper center, square relief: □彦？; LLC, rectangular intaglio; sticker on R roller end: [Beisanjin]
signed: top center: 仲秋七十翁米山人
title: Old Woman on an Ox
